description: Improving Cultural Understanding in Bosnia and Herzegovina

subproject.corporate outcome: Policies, strategies and partnerships established to enhance public-private sector collaboration and private sector and market development that benefit the poor and ensure that low-income households and small enterprises have access to a broad range of financial and legal services
subproject.description:
Improved policies & legal frameworks in culture and education sectors.	

Established framework for mapping Culture Sector -  including detailed analysis of culture public sector (legislative, financial, infrastructure and human resources analysis), creation of culture sector directory, new classification of cultural industries and comprehensive culture sector research including assessment of culture industries.	

Cross-cutting issues – Gender, Youth and Social Inclusion within culture sector addressed in the Action Plan.	

		
Trainings provided to Monitoring and Evaluation Working Group and on the job training provided through participating in monitoring of local MDGF projects.	
	
Joint criteria for selection of core localities (municipalities and consortium of municipalities) developed.	

	
Participatory monitoring of local project's implementation undertaken. 	
Number of community based projects selected for implementation of cross-cultural 
understanding projects.
Participatory evaluation of municipaities based on joint criteria undertaken. 
At least 10 local projects selected that enhance cultural industries and/or cultural tourism. 	
Increased number of positive public discourses on interculturalism.	
	
	
	
Assessment of media messages on cultural and development undertaken.	
	
Information Campaign prepared and delivered aiming at cultural diversity, tolerance and understanding in gender-sensitive manner.	
		
Provided assistance to media production related to documentary films that promote intercultural understanding .	
	
	
	
	
	

Prepared methodology for inclusive monitoring of the community based project implementation.	
	

	

	

	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Institutions technically equipped for preparation of Action Plan and related policy activities.	
	
	
	
Key relevant institutional partners at state and entity level trained in applicable gender mechanisms for policy making.	
	
	
Increased number of gender-based discourses and implementation of gender law.	
	Improved policies & legal frameworks in culture and education sectors.	
	
	
Established framework for mapping Culture Sector -  including detailed analysis of culture public sector (legislative, financial, infrastructure and human resources analysis), creation of culture sector directory, new classification of cultural industries and comprehensive culture sector research including assessment of culture industries.	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Conceptual framework for Culture Portal prepared.	
	
	
	
Cross-cutting issues – Gender, Youth and Social Inclusion within culture sector addressed in the Action Plan.	
	
	
	
First draft BiH Action Plan based on National Culture Strategy developed and agreed by institutional partners and PMC.	
	
	
Number of activities/issues identified in the Action Plan as priorities and  addressed by the project and institutional partners.	
	
	
	
Working Groups for development of Action Plan and development of Culture Portal established in the entity Ministries of Culture and state Ministry of Civil Affairs.	
	
	
Regional learning programmes organised and key stakeholders in culture and development participated in exchange programmes.	
	
	
	
At least one Study visit (Exchange Programme) organised for wider cultureal stakeholders (institutions, museums, theaters, libraries, artists, NGOS, religious representatives etc.)	
	
	
Broader-range  stakeholders participated in working meetings and conferences and are informed about Cultural mapping as well as about Development of Action Plan activities.	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Framework for comprehensive and multi-functional BiH culture portal/exchange platform developed.	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Institutions technically equipped for preparation of Action Plan and related policy activities.	
	
	
	
Key relevant institutional partners at state and entity level trained in applicable gender mechanisms for policy making.	
	
	
Increased number of gender-based discourses and implementation of gender law.	
	Improved policies & legal frameworks in culture and education sectors.	
	
	
Established framework for mapping Culture Sector -  including detailed analysis of culture public sector (legislative, financial, infrastructure and human resources analysis), creation of culture sector directory, new classification of cultural industries and comprehensive culture sector research including assessment of culture industries.	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Conceptual framework for Culture Portal prepared.	
	
	
	
Cross-cutting issues – Gender, Youth and Social Inclusion within culture sector addressed in the Action Plan.	
	
	
	
First draft BiH Action Plan based on National Culture Strategy developed and agreed by institutional partners and PMC.	
	
	
Number of activities/issues identified in the Action Plan as priorities and  addressed by the project and institutional partners.	
	
	
	
Working Groups for development of Action Plan and development of Culture Portal established in the entity Ministries of Culture and state Ministry of Civil Affairs.	
	
	
Regional learning programmes organised and key stakeholders in culture and development participated in exchange programmes.	
	
	
	
At least one Study visit (Exchange Programme) organised for wider cultureal stakeholders (institutions, museums, theaters, libraries, artists, NGOS, religious representatives etc.)	
	
	
Broader-range  stakeholders participated in working meetings and conferences and are informed about Cultural mapping as well as about Development of Action Plan activities.	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Framework for comprehensive and multi-functional BiH culture portal/exchange platform developed.	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
	
Institutions technically equipped for preparation of Action Plan and related policy activities.	
	
	
	
Key relevant institutional partners at state and entity level trained in applicable gender mechanisms for policy making.	
	
	
Increased number of gender-based discourses and implementation of gender law.
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
